item.title: ME:: white, the 'right' asians etc nothing has changed in the tech 'mirrortocracy' since 2014 ; Carlos Bueno:: 2014::Inside the Mirrortocracy
item.description: Discovered: Jan 19, 2026 16:21 (UTC) ME:: white, the â€˜rightâ€™ asians etc nothing has changed in the tech â€˜mirrortocracyâ€™ since 2014 ; Carlos Bueno:: 2014::Inside the Mirrortocracy <- QUOTE: So the second step is on you. InÂ­stead of deÂ­mandÂ­ing that othÂ­ers reÂ­flect your views, reÂ­flect on yourÂ­self. Try to reÂ­membÂ­er the last time someÂ­one sucÂ­cessfulÂ­ly chanÂ­ged your mind. Try, just for a moÂ­ment, to supÂ­pose that it's proÂ­babÂ­ly unÂ­naturÂ­al for an inÂ­dustÂ­ry to be so heaviÂ­ly dominated by white/asian middle-class males under 30 who keep tellÂ­ing each other to only hire their friends. HavÂ­ing supÂ­posed that, think about what a just fuÂ­ture should look like, and how to get there.

item.title: ME:: Isn't a web server part of macOS already?!?!? ; BejBej apps:: Personal Web Server
item.description:
Discovered: Jan 13, 2026 18:42 (UTC) ME:: Isnâ€™t this a web server part of macOS already?!?!? ; BejBej apps:: Personal Web Server

QUOTE:

Personal Web Server is a simple web server for personal use, select a folder on your mac and it serves the contents of that folder to the network. Some features include:

  • App can only access the selected folder, no files outside of the selected folder can be accessed.
  • You can customize the listening port of web server
  • Runs in background

item.title: Agree, do not upgrade to macOS 26 ; Daring Fireball: Why Itâ€™s Difficult to Resize Windows on MacOS 26 Dyehoe
item.description: Discovered: Jan 12, 2026 19:25 (UTC) Agree, do not upgrade to macOS 26 ; Daring Fireball: Why Itâ€™s Difficult to Resize Windows on MacOS 26 Dyehoe <â€“ QUOTE: The good news is, I have a solution. Do not upgrade to MacOS 26 Tahoe. If you have already upgraded, downgrade. Why suffer willingly with a user interface that presents you with absurdities like window resizing affordances that are 75 percent outside the window?

item.title: ME:: tl;dr AI: AGI is more like twitter than jet engines in that it is fed by people and not predictable and not apparent from inside the software industry how others use it. But how general is it? And I agree, where do we go from here? Still skeptical but super thought provoking piece ; Robin Sloan:: AGI is here (and I feel fine)
item.description:
Discovered: Jan 12, 2026 17:05 (UTC) ME:: tl;dr AI: AGI is more like twitter than jet engines in that it is fed by people and not predictable and not apparent from inside the software industry how others use it. But how general is it? And I agree, where do we go from here? Still skeptical but super thought provoking piece ; Robin Sloan:: AGI is here (and I feel fine)

QUOTE:

Itâ€™s not that the comÂ­paÂ­nies donâ€™t know anyÂ­thingâ€Šâ€”â€Šthey know a lotâ€”but rather that a regÂ­ular user can have an expeÂ­riÂ­ence with these sysÂ­tems, an idea about them, that is not availÂ­able to even the deepest, dankest, insider-iest insider.â€‚I contend that regÂ­ular users are having such expeÂ­riÂ­ences & ideas all the time.

I think this is just how these sysÂ­tems work, when they have so many difÂ­ferent people using them for so many difÂ­ferent reaÂ­sons.â€‚Itâ€™s pretty weird, comÂ­pared to other products.â€‚After all, the comÂ­pany that manÂ­uÂ­facÂ­tures jet engines & sells them to five cusÂ­tomers can reaÂ­sonÂ­ably claim to underÂ­stand the uses of those engines.

Thatâ€™s all to say, for all the math & matÃ©riel involved in their care & feeding, the big models are more like Twitter than they are like jet engines, & this whole thing was a surÂ­prise anywayâ€Šâ€”â€Šfrom which no one has quite recoveredâ€Šâ€”â€Šso I will defend vigÂ­orÂ­ously the right of anyÂ­body/everyÂ­body to reflect & opine on AIâ€™s propÂ­erÂ­ties & potential, & to declare, when it seems obvious: AGI is here.

Recently, I have been reading a lot about the early hisÂ­tory of perÂ­sonal comÂ­puters, the 1970s & 1980s. (This book was wonderful, because its presentâ€Šâ€”â€Šthe pinÂ­nacle from which it surÂ­veys a tumulÂ­tuous hisÂ­toryâ€Šâ€”â€Šisâ€‰â€¦â€‰1984.) Itâ€™s been interÂ­esting to disÂ­cover that many of the visions & promises of that era â€œrhymeâ€ with the visions & promises of the present boom.â€‚Itâ€™s clear that Bay Area tech is, if not one conÂ­tinÂ­uous project, 1957-2026, then for sure one conÂ­tinÂ­uous culture. (I happen to think itâ€™s one conÂ­tinÂ­uous project.)

The pace is familiar, too: hot new comÂ­paÂ­nies were appearing every month, fading just as fast.â€‚Yes, the dollar amounts were smallerâ€Šâ€”â€Šthe comÂ­puter was still a niche productâ€Šâ€”â€Šbut the feelÂ­ings really seem to be the same.

Andâ€‰â€¦â€‰the visions of that era were subÂ­stanÂ­tially realizedâ€Š!â€‚Today, everyÂ­body really does own a perÂ­sonal comÂ­puter, or someÂ­thing like one.â€‚Everybody really is conÂ­nected to a global inforÂ­maÂ­tion network, or someÂ­thing like one.

Iâ€™m an avid user of both my perÂ­sonal comÂ­puter & the global inforÂ­maÂ­tion network, & I observe that we appear not to live in utopia.â€‚The andâ€‰â€¦â€‰? of those invenÂ­tions roars in our ears.

Today, everyÂ­body really can call upon AGI, or someÂ­thing like it: a wildly genÂ­eral comÂ­puter program.â€‚I meanâ€Š!â€‚Wow!

The quesÂ­tion, always, forever: what now?

item.title: Things that Work: Hario Tetsuya Kasuya Double Stainless All Metal Pourover Dripper with Aramse Sofi Top and holder. Best pourover coffee ever :-) !
item.description:
1. Place the Hario Double Stainless Dripperãƒ»KASUYA Modelon top of your coffee cup or carafe and add your ground coffee.
  2. Place the Aramse Sofi holder on top of the Tetsuya dripper and then place the top part of the Aramse Sofi brewer on top of the stand
  3. Use your favourite pourover method. The Armase Sofi top part acts as a shower head. No need for a fancy pourover kettle.

No plastic! And super coffee with no fines. Disclaimer: I have no interest financially or otherwise in Hario or Aramse. Love them both!
